alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 4:49AM EST until March 07 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Montgomery and Preble. * WHEN...Until 745 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 AM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Miamisburg, Springboro, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Carlisle, South Middletown, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Darrtown, Four Bridges, Hunter, Reily, New Miami, Millville and Somerville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
